User Story:
As a
Key Wealth User
I want
to ensure all servicing workflows that require interactions with Salesforce(B2C) and Envestnet have a defined solution
So that
we can ensure our business processes function as needed in future state
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
We have compiled a list of all current state servicing workflows
When
Reviewed to ensure all required Salesforce (B2C) and Envestnet workflow interactions are accounted for, including:
Invest
Divest
Funding
Withdrawal
Termination
Account Maintenance
Updating Models
Then
We should see those updatesincluded in all future stateworkflows

User Story:
As a
Key Wealth User
I want
to identify all servicing scenarios that could be improved that are not workflow dependent
So that
we can make our processing more efficient
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
We have identified all servicing scenarios that could be improved,that are not workflow dependent
When
Reviewing future state workflows and an opportunity arises for improvement:
process driven
technical enhancements
Then
We can make updates to workflowsthat reflect these changes

User Story:
As a 
KIS FO user
I want 
the KIS client user onboarding workflow to create a new SIS document
So that 
it can be included in the new account enrollment package.
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
Key Investment Services onboarding process workflows are being updated
When
an advisor is onboarding a client/new account
Then
a new SIS (Statement of Investment Selection) document should be created
Note: This is a one-time development story for the creation of the new document for the very first time in the future state.

User Story:
As a
KIS FO user
I want
the KIS client user onboarding workflow to send an email with consent to enroll in e-delivery/paperless statements document
So that
it can encourage clients to enroll in e-delivery/paperless statements
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
Key wealth onboarding process workflows are being updated
When
a new account is being onboarded for a KIS client
Then
an email should be sent to clients (as part of campaign trigger) to encourage them for consenting to enroll in e-delivery/paperless statements

User Story:
As a
Key wealth leader
I want
the new documents to be included in the enrollment package
So that
the client can sign physically or digitally
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
Key wealth onboarding processworkflows are being updated
When
the draft account is created inCob 2.0/Net X
Then
the SIS document should be included in the new account onboarding package for the clients to sign physically or digitally.
Note:
This story is for including SIS in the new account enrollment package

User Story:
As a 
Wealth Leader
I want 
the two-day delay to be made near real-time
So that 
client and account information is available to enroll into online banking and access their accounts
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
a client with no online banking access is being onboarded
Or
the client has online banking but needs access to the new account
When
the account is active in Pershing
Then
the relevant client information should be made available for IBX real-time
And
client should be encouraged to enroll into online banking if they haven’t already.
And
have access to the new account in online banking when they enroll.

User Story:
As a
Key wealth leader
I want
the new Key wealth client user onboarding workflow in Salesforce to pre-fill data wherever possible
So that
I do not have to re-keydata.
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
an advisor/RM is in Salesforce to create a wealth client/opportunity/prospect
When
prior information on the client/opportunity/prospect exists in the wealth instance of Salesforce
Then
the existing data should get auto populated and editable, where applicable.

User Story:
As a
KIS FO user
I want
to ensure that the new KIS client account onboarding workflow is able to autopopulate data where applicable, within RSQ
So that
I do not have to re-keydata.
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
an advisor is onboarding a client
When
filling in the RSQ within Salesforce
If
a previously completed RSQ exists for the same client
Then
appropriate data attributes of the RSQ should be auto populated
and editable, to eliminate rekeying of data.

User Story:
As a
KIS FO user
I want
to ensure that the new KIS client account onboarding workflow is able to autopopulate data where applicable in Right Bridge
So that
I do not have to re-keydata.
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
an advisor is onboarding a client/account
When
in RightBridge for doing Reg BI
Then
the client/lead/prospect’s information should be autopopulated in RightBridge whereapplicable, to eliminate re-keying of data.

User Story:
As a
KIS FO user
I want
to begin the onboarding process through Salesforce
So that
Salesforce becomes the single point of origination
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
Key Investment Services onboarding process workflows are being updated
When
onboarding a KIS account
Then
advisors should be able to initiate that onboarding process only through Salesforce
And
Not allowed to begin the process from anywhere else

User Story:
As a
KIS FO user
I want
to create a new or update an existing client/lead/opportunity in Salesforce B2C 
So that
the client information can be made available for future servicing.
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
Key Investment Services onboarding process workflows are being updated
When
creating a new or updating an existing client/lead/opportunity in Salesforce
Then
the client record should be created/updated with data entered currently, for future servicing.

User Story:
As a
KIS FO user
I want
to initiate proposal creation process through Salesforce for a new client being onboarded
So that
RSQ can be done
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
a new KIS account is being onboarded
When
advisor initiates the proposal creation process
Then
the advisor should be able to launch the Risk Survey Questionnaire

User Story:
As a 
KIS FO user
I want 
to leverage existing RSQ (for a wealth account) on file for a client that has a “Pass” outcome and is less than 29 days old So that 
the account onboarding process can continue without rerunning RSQ for the client
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
a new KIS account is being onboarded
When
advisor initiates the proposal creation process
Then
the advisor should be able to skip RSQ if there is an existing RSQ (for a wealth account) on file that has a “Pass” outcome and is less than 29 days old for the client

User Story:
As a
KIS FO user
I want
to run RSQ process through Salesforce for every authorized signatory nominated in the account in the case of an Entity
So that
Risk Survey Questionnaire can be done for every single one of them.
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
a new KIS account is beingon boarded for an Entity
When advisor initiates the proposal creation process
Then
the advisor should be able to launch the Risk Survey Questionnaire for authorized signatory for the account

User Story:
As a
KIS FO user
I want
the KIS account onboarding workflow to make RSQ process through Salesforce mandatory only for a new account being onboarded
So that
the workflow does not make RSQ mandatory when an existing account is being modified.
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
an existing KIS account is being modified for adding new product(s)
When
advisor initiates the process of editing such account
Then
the advisor should be able to SSO into RightBridge, opting not to do RSQ for the existing account.

User Story:
As a
KIS FO user
I want
to see an RSQ pass message on screen when client’s RSQ is a pass
So that
the outcome can be captured for audit trail
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
advisor has submitted RSQ for aclient
When
the client’s RSQ is a pass
Then
advisor should see an RSQ pass message on screen.
And
the audit record captured for the outcome

User Story:
As a
KIS FO user
I want
to see an RSQ fail prompt with appropriate reason
So that
I am made aware of the reason for the failure and the outcome captured for audit trail
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
advisor has submitted RSQ for aclient
When
the client’s RSQ is a fail
Then
advisor should see an RSQ fail message with reason on screen.
And
the audit record captured for theoutcome along with the reasonfor failure.

User Story:
As a
KIS FO user
I want
the ability to reinitiate RSQ
So that
I can redo the RSQ at any time
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
advisor has submitted RSQ
When
the outcome of the RSQ is a failure or a pass
Then
advisor should be able to launch and complete the RSQ again without any limitations.

User Story:
As a
KIS FO user
I want
the KIS account onboarding workflow to be built to initiate RSQ independently or redo RSQ when it fails
So that
I can initiate or redo RSQ at any time
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
advisor is editing an existing account to add new products
Or
RSQ has failed or expired
When
a need arises to initiate RSQ through Salesforce
Then
advisor should be able to launch and complete the RSQ without any limitations.

User Story:
As a
KIS FO user
I want
to be notified on screen if I want to SSO into Product Profiler in Right Bridge once the client’s RSQ is a pass in Salesforce
So that
I can pause the onboarding temporarily or continue to SSO into RightBridge for Reg BI.
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
a new account is being opened/proposed
When
the client’s RSQ is a pass in Salesforce
Then
I must have the option to SSO onto Rightbridge’s Client Information Shortcuts
OR
pause the process and return to it at a later time

User Story:
As a
KIS FO user
I want
to select from a RightBridge short cut menu based on client information
So that
the Reg BI questions can be tailored based on the menu selection
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
Client’s RSQ is a pass
When
Advisor opts to SSO into RightBridge
Then
a RightBridge short cut menu must be presented to the user based on client information
And
the Reg BI questions should be tailored based on the menu selection.
Then
a RightBridge short cut menu must be presented to the user based on client information

User Story:
As a
KIS FO user
I want
Salesforce to have access to Reg BI PDF in RightBridge
So that
the Reg BI PDF can be retrieved from RightBridge on demand with in Salesforce
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
Reg BI process is completed
When
The Reg BI documentation is generated in RightBridge
Then
Salesforce must be able to access the PDF from RightBridge on demand.

User Story:
As a
KIS FO user
I want
to SSO into Envestnet from Salesforce
So that
I can begin the proposal creation process for a managed account
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
the client has been deemed eligible for a managed account by Reg BI
When
Advisor launches proposal creation through Salesforce
Then
advisor should be allowed to SSO into an Envestnet proposal page for the new account

User Story:
As a
KIS FO user
I want
to be able to provide additional client information in Salesforce
So that
this information can be prefilled while creating a Net X draft account
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
The client has been deemedeligible for a non-managed
(brokerage) account by Reg BIprocess
When
advisor launches the appropriate screen in Salesforce to SSO into Net X
Then
the advisor should be able to enter additional client information before SSO’ing into Net X
And
Have that additional information prefilled to create a Net X draft account.
Note:
SSO into Cob2.0/Net X can happen only after Reg BI PDF is in Salesforce for a non-managed account.

User Story:
As a
KIS FO user
I want
to SSO into Net X from Salesforce
So that
I can create a draft Net X account for non-managed/brokerage account
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
The client has been deemed eligible for a non-managed
(brokerage) account by Reg BI process
When
additional client information is filled in and submitted in a Salesforce page
Then
the advisor should be able to SSO into Cob 2.0/Net X to create a draft account
Note:
SSO into Cob2.0/Net X canhappen only after Reg BI PDF isin Salesforce for a non-managedaccount.

User Story:
As a
KIS FO user
I want
the Reg BI PDF data to be sent to Net X from Salesforce at the time of SSO launch into Net X
So that
the Reg BI documentation is made available in Net X
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
Reg BI process is completed
When
advisor SSO’s into Net X fromSalesforce
Then
the appropriate client account’s Reg BI data should be sent for accessing the document in NetX

User Story:
As a
KIS FO user
I want
all documentation for opening a new client managed/non-account to be made available within Net X
So that
CSG can review them.
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
KIS client onboarding workflows are being updated
When
all documentation from client and KIS FO user has been completed and returned for opening a managed/non-managed account
Then
all such the documentation must be made available in Net X for CSG’s review.

User Story:
As a
KIS FO user
I want
the ability to pause onboarding process at any time
So that
I am able to resume from where I left, at any point intime.
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
KIS client onboarding workflows are being updated
When
the advisor completes any step in the onboarding process
Then
they should be able to pause the onboarding process at any time
And
be able to resume from where they left, at any point in time.

User Story:
As a 
Key Wealth User
I want 
to identify all of the different unique wealth roles that exist across the FO,MO, and BO, and their capabilities 
So that 
I can ensure all roles and capabilities are considered when designing the future state
Acceptance Criteria:
Given 
there currently exist various unique roles across Key Wealth and they all have different capabilities 
When we identify all of these roles and capabilities
Then we should have full coverage of every single role
AND know what their job requires them to do
AND there should not be a single role that isn’t convered

User Story:
As a 
Key Wealth User
I want 
to ensure that I can SSO from various applications, directly to Envestnet
So that 
I launch directly from those applications to ENV in-context
Acceptance Criteria:
Given 
an Envestnet user is in another wealth application
When 
a user wants to that application to launch Envestnet
Then 
the user should be able to SSO from that application to the appropriate screen in Envestnet

User Story:
As a 
Key Wealth FO user
I want 
to be able to SSO from an in-progress proposal in SF, directly to that same proposal in Envestnet
So that 
I do not have to perform more actions to get from the proposal in SF, to that same proposal in Envestnet
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
there is already an in-progress proposal in SF
When
the user is in that specific client’s profile in SF
Then
they should be able to SSO from the proposal in SF, directly to that same proposal in Envestnet

User Story:
As a 
Key Wealth FO user
I want 
to be able to SSO from my SF homepage to a list of all my open proposals, in Envestnet
So that I can easily access and follow-up on all my ongoing proposals
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
the user in Salesforce has open proposals in Envestnet
When
that user wishes to see a list of all open Envestnet proposals
Then
they should be able to SSO from the SF homepage to a list of all open proposals in Envestnet

User Story:
As a 
Key Wealth User
I want 
to ensure that data within the DSC including ENV enriched Key data is available to B2C and includes managed flag indicators
So that 
actions in other systems can be automatically reconciled within B2C
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
Envestnet-enriched Key datais stored within DSC
When
this data is required by Salesforce (B2C)
Then
this data should be availablefor ingestion from DSC, and includemanage flag indicators

User Story:
As a 
KIS FO User accessing a specific client/household profile in Salesforce
I want 
to ensure that I am being notified on Salesforce, MAR was completed
So that I am notified of an pending due, or overdue MAR
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
a FO user is on a specific client/house hold profile in Salesforce
Then
I should be notified on SF see that a new MAR is due
AND
the notification should specify in how many days the MAR is due, oris overdue

User Story:
As a 
Key FO user
I want 
to only be able to complete MARs in Envestnet
So that 
there is a single system in which MARs are completed
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
MARs capability in Envestnet is fully functional
When
I attempt to complete a MAR on SF
Then
I should not be able to complete any part of MAR on SF
AND
I should only be notified on SF

User Story:
As a
Key Wealth User
I want
the historical records of MARS that will not be migrated to Envestnet, to remain in Salesforce
So that
a historical record will persist for audit and compliance purposes
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
only MARS post 31/12/2024 will be migrated to Envestnet
When
the MARS
pre
31/12/2024 are not migrated
Then
they should remain in SF in the current form.
AND should persist as per the required records retention policies

User Story:
As a 
Key Wealth User
I want 
to ensure that I cannot override (on SF) information that is being displayed on SF, that is being sourced from a core system
So that 
I am not changing information on a consuming system while the core system remains inaccurate
Acceptance Criteria:
Given 
there is data being displayed on SF that is sourced from a different core system
When 
that data is incorrect
Then 
I must not be allowed to overwrite that information in SF
directly
AND
I must be able to update the information in the source core
system in an authenticated manner

User Story:
As a
Key Wealth User
I want
to cleanup all source systems' householding information
So that
we can ensure accuracy of the custom householding file that we will feed to Envestnet (one-time activity)
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
house holding information currently exists in disparate systems
AND
we will be using that information to create the one-time custom householding file that we will be feeding to Envestnet
Then
we should clean up all householding data prior to using that same data to establish the one-time custom house holding file

User Story:
As a
Key FO user
I want
the Client Contact Record updated in Salesforce when an annual Managed Account Review (MARS) is completed in Envestnet
So that
the Client Contact Record is kept up to date with changes to a Client’s account
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
An account requires an annual MARS (Managed Account Review)
When
The annual MARS (Managed Account Review) has been completed in Envestnet
Then
I should see Client Contact Record in Salesforce updated showing the annual MARS(Managed Account Review) was completed

User Story:
As a
Key FO user
I want
the Client Contact Record updated in Salesforce when a financial plan is created in MoneyGuide Pro
So that
the Client Contact Record is kept up to date with changes to a Client’s account
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
An Advisor needs to create a financial plan for a Client
When
A financial plan is created
Then
I should see the Client Contact Record in Salesforce updated showing a financial plan was created in MoneyGuide Pro

User Story:
As a
Key Private Client Advisor
I want
Salesforce to generate a “to-do” follow-up action to meet with client in
'X'
number of days post MARS (ManagedAccount Review) completion,or allow me to manually select a time period for follow-up
So that
I am reminded to meet with the Client post-MARS.
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
I have completed a MARS
When
The Statement of Investment Selection change is completed in Envestnet
Then
I should receive a “to-do” follow-up action reminder in Salesforce X number of days post MARS completion or, if I manually chose a number of days to follow-up, I should receive a “to-do” follow-up action reminder based on that selection

User Story:
As a
Key FO user
I want
the Salesforce Client Contact Record updated if there is a Statement of Investment Selection change event in Envestnet
So that
the Client Contact Record is kept up to date with changes to a Client’s account
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
There is a change to the Statement of Investment Selection
When 
The Statement of Investment Selection change is completed in Envestnet
Then
I should see the Client Contact Record in Salesforce updated showing there was a change to the Statement of Investment Selection

User Story:
As a 
Salesforce user
I want 
to ensure that all values that I am seeing on Salesforce, are accurate as of when I am seeing them 
So that 
there is no discrepancy between values in Salesforce and other
systems
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
a value is being loaded from DSC and being displayed in Salesforce
When
that value is being displayed in Salesforce
Then
that value should be accurately displayed with the latest information

User Story:
As a 
Key Wealth User
I want 
to capture the ASPV 13-05 and 13-12 records for Agent & Communication information 
So that 
we can support the Salesforce and hierarchy file build
Acceptance Criteria:
Given 
Key Bank deals in Annuities
When 
we receive all the Annuities files
Then 
we should capture the ASPV 13-05 and 13-12 records for Agent & Communication information

User Story:
As a 
Salesforce user
I want 
to ensure that all relevant annuities data is being reflected in Salesforce
So that 
I can get an accurate picture of my clients' invested assets
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
all required Annuities data exists in DSC
When
there are any relevant fields in Salesforce that should be considering Annuities data
Then
I would expect Salesforce to consider and reflect Annuities data in all values being presented to the advisor in SF

User Story:
As a 
Salesforce user
I want 
to ensure that all relevant fund direct data is being reflected in Salesforce
So that 
I can get an accurate picture of my clients' invested assets
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
all required Fund Direct data exists in DSC
When
there are any relevant fields in Salesforce that should be considering Fund Directdata
Then
I would expect Salesforce to consider and reflect Fund direct data in all values being presented to the advisor in SF

User Story:
As a 
Front Office User
I want 
the capability to easily send my client relevant CIO/Firm collateral education and enrichment materials
So that 
they can be informed on products and market trends
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
I am a Front Office User
When
I need to send my client any relevant CIO/Firm collateral education and enrichment materials
Then
I should have the ability to send only information I deem relevant to my Client
